stories.text:
Please state the location and include REMOTE, INTERNS and/or VISA when that sort of candidate is welcome. When remote work is not an option, include ONSITE. Please only post if you personally are part of the hiring company—no recruiting firms or job boards. Only one post per company. If it isn't a household name, please explain what your company does.

Commenters: please don't reply to job posts to complain about something. It's off topic here.

Readers: please only email if you are personally interested in the job.

Don't have a careers page and applicant tracking system? Check out https://www.jobspage.co
stories.title: Ask HN: Who is hiring? (July 2022)
The Cybersecurity Skills Gap Is Another Instance of Late-Stage Capitalism
Google AI Developed a Language Model to Solve Quantitative Reasoning Problems
The Blockchain in a Historical Perspective

stories.text:
Hello HN, I cannot find this interesting article about system thinking/theory I read. I'm pretty sure I had found it on hacker news.

What I remember is that it made the example of a village as a system, and the max population the village could reach by foraging in a certain area. It was very long and there were lots of images illustrating the concepts. Searching systems thinking/theory on algolia didn't help. If you help me finding it back I would be very grateful.
stories.title: Ask HN: Can you help me find an intersting article about system thinking
The Nuclear Accidents at Chalk River

stories.text:
Using a single ultra widescreen or multiple 16:9 or any other ratio monitors is now common even in office spaces must people are using at least two screens.

I wonder what is the setup for different HN readers. Being in software engineering or any other line of business. Some information that can probably be helpful for future searchers and readers:

- How many screens do you have? - What is aspect ratio of each screen? - What is your primary use of the setup?

As description please feel free to add your best practices, routines, etc. on how you maximise the usage.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you use your (ultra/wide) monitor/s?
One Vulnerable Jenkins Server, That's All They Need
Show HN: Atorable-Loader – Build a website that serves itself
